private_information: I am free the entire Monday from 09:00 to 17:00
I do not want to meet on Monday after 09:30
benjamin.goal: Schedule a 30 minute meeting on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 that fits all participants schedules and preferences.

private_information: I am free the entire Monday from 09:00 to 17:00
hannah.goal: Schedule a 30 minute meeting on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 that fits all participants schedules and preferences.

private_information: I have meetings on Monday during 09:30-10:00
I have meetings on Monday during 11:30-12:30
I have meetings on Monday during 14:00-16:30
brenda.goal: Schedule a 30 minute meeting on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 that fits all participants schedules and preferences.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate participant availabilities and produce a PDDL domain and problem targeting the FastDownward solver that schedules a 30 minute meeting on Monday satisfying all constraints.

public_information: Schedule must be a single 30 minute contiguous slot on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00
All participants must be available for the entire meeting duration
There exists at least one feasible slot given current schedules and preferences

collect_availability.system_prompt: You are the agent representing Benjamin. Using the public environment information and your private constraints, provide your available time slots for a 30 minute meeting on Monday as a list of non overlapping time intervals in the format HH:MM-HH:MM. Do not emit PDDL. Be precise and only report slots that meet your preference not to meet after 09:30.

You are the agent representing Hannah. Using the public environment information and your private constraints, provide your available time slots for a 30 minute meeting on Monday as a list of non overlapping time intervals in the format HH:MM-HH:MM. Do not emit PDDL.

You are the agent representing Brenda. Using the public environment information and your private constraints, provide your available time slots for a 30 minute meeting on Monday as a list of non overlapping time intervals in the format HH:MM-HH:MM. Do not emit PDDL.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent scheduling and PDDL. Your task is to integrate the structured availability reports from the participants and produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem suitable for the FastDownward solver that encodes the meeting scheduling task. Keep participant actions and identities distinct in the encoding. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Do not assume additional private information beyond what is provided.
pddl.prompt: You will receive the following public environment information, participant private information, and their availability reports. Create a PDDL domain and problem that model scheduling a single 30 minute meeting on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 subject to participant availabilities and preferences. Use the FastDownward-compatible PDDL features only. Include agents as separate actors if helpful and ensure the resulting plan selects a concrete start time for the meeting that is feasible for all participants. Public information: {environment->public_information} Participant private information: Benjamin: {agents->benjamin->private_information} Hannah: {agents->hannah->private_information} Brenda: {agents->brenda->private_information} Participant availability reports: {availability_benjamin} {availability_hannah} {availability_brenda} Produce the PDDL domain and problem files. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> tags and the problem between <problem></problem> tags.
